problem.markdown:
1. Dielectric oil used in transformer is
( ) Vegetable oil ( ) Refined Mineral oil ( ) Synthetic oil ( ) None of the above
2. Oil used in transformer for-
( ) Cooling ( ) Dielectric ( ) Lubricating ( ) Both for cooling and dielectric
3. The flash temperature of dielectric oil used in transformer
( ) 1400 C ( ) 2000 C ( ) 3000 C ( ) 300 C
4. The dielectric strength of transformer oil is-
( ) 25 kV/mm. ( ) 50 kV/mm. ( ) 12 kV/mm. ( ) 10 kV/mm.
5. The color of good transformer oil is-
( ) Dark Black ( ) Transparent Yellow ( ) Dark Blue ( ) None of the above
6. When oil decomposed it liberates-
( ) Carbon ( ) Hydrogen ( ) Carbon and Hydrogen ( ) None
7. Dielectric strengths of Air at NTP is
( ) 50 kV/mm ( ) 25 kV/mm ( ) 12 kV/mm ( ) 3 kV/mm
8. The Break Down Voltage (BDV) of transformer oil is measured when-
( ) One point flash occurs ( ) Two point flash occurs ( ) Multi point flash occurs ( ) None of the above
9. The most commonly used unit of dielectric strength is -
( ) kV/mm. ( ) V/cm. ( ) MV/mm. ( ) kV/m.
10. The maximum pour point temperature of dielectric oil is-
( ) -60 C ( ) 100 C ( ) 10 C ( ) 500 C
